greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of sum of inverses of unrestricted partition function.
comment: One could just as well sum from n >= 0, giving a value one higher. - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Nov 30 2018
link: Vaclav Kotesovec, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
mathematica: digits = 100; NSum[1/PartitionsP[n], {n, 1, Infinity}, NSumTerms -> 10000, WorkingPrecision -> digits+1] // RealDigits[#, 10, digits]& // First (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 21 2014 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = if( n<-1, 0, n++; default( realprecision, n+5); floor( suminf( k=1, 1 / numbpart(k)) * 10^n) % 10)} /* _Michael Somos_, Feb 05 2011 */
results.author: _Ralf Stephan_, Jan 05 2003
ext: Corrected digits from position 32 on by _Ralf Stephan_, Jan 24 2011
